channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jimmy Carter is no saint in my house
item.description: For President Biden's legacy, we should look to late President Jimmy Carter's history in Central America.
item.content:encoded:
For President Biden's legacy, we should look to late President Jimmy Carter's history in Central America.

(Image credit: Erik S. Lesser)

item.title: 10 people have died in the wildfires spreading across Southern California
item.description: The number of dead tied to the wildfires increases as local officials warn the toll will increase. About 180,000 people have had to evacuate.
item.content:encoded:
The number of dead tied to the wildfires increases as local officials warn the toll will increase. About 180,000 people have had to evacuate.

(Image credit: Ethan Swope)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Hey, meat eaters. Your gut health can rival a vegan's. Here's how
item.description: Our guts are home to trillions of microbes that influence our health. A new study finds the key to a healthy microbiome is the variety of plant-based food in your diet, even if you eat meat.
item.content:encoded:
Our guts are home to trillions of microbes that influence our health. A new study finds the key to a healthy microbiome is the variety of plant-based food in your diet, even if you eat meat.

(Image credit: fcafotodigital)
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: After 17 years, it's Hoda Kotb's last 'Today' show
item.description: Craig Melvin, current news anchor and host of Today's 3rd Hour, has been named Kotb's successor.
item.content:encoded:
Craig Melvin, current news anchor and host of Today's 3rd Hour, has been named Kotb's successor.

(Image credit: Nathan Congleton)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: How these suburban moms in Ukraine manage grief by training to down Russian drones
item.description: Women from a Kyiv suburb traumatized by a 2022 massacre by Russian troops joined a volunteer air defense unit to take down Russia's drones — and deal with their fears.
item.content:encoded:
Women from a Kyiv suburb traumatized by a 2022 massacre by Russian troops joined a volunteer air defense unit to take down Russia's drones — and deal with their fears.

(Image credit: Oksana Parafeniuk for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Kakissis

item.title: TikTok is heading to the Supreme Court to challenge its U.S. ban. Here's what to know
item.description: Lawyers for TikTok will argue that banning the app will violate the free speech of 170 million American users. The Justice Department will contend that the app is a national security risk.
item.content:encoded:
Lawyers for TikTok will argue that banning the app will violate the free speech of 170 million American users. The Justice Department will contend that the app is a national security risk.

(Image credit: Roni Bintang)
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: Who's in, who's out and who wants to rename the Gulf of Mexico? The quiz is back!
item.description: This week, we tackle the Golden Globes, free speech, Girl Scout cookies, dragons and more. Add a perfect score to your New Year's resolutions!
item.content:encoded:
This week, we tackle the Golden Globes, free speech, Girl Scout cookies, dragons and more. Add a perfect score to your New Year's resolutions!

(Image credit: Amy Sussman/Getty Images, Harry How/Getty Images, Amy Sussman/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Q&A: CIA Chief on how the U.S. intel community handled Russia, China and Mideast
item.description: In an exit interview with NPR's Mary Louise Kelly, CIA Director William Burns says he still thinks "there's a chance" for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.content:encoded:
In an exit interview with NPR's Mary Louise Kelly, CIA Director William Burns says he still thinks "there's a chance" for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.

(Image credit: Dee Dwyer for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Trump set for sentencing in his New York felony conviction
item.description: Trump on Thursday exhausted his last legal maneuver to stop the sentencing, after a narrow majority of Supreme Court justices declined to intervene.
item.content:encoded:
Trump on Thursday exhausted his last legal maneuver to stop the sentencing, after a narrow majority of Supreme Court justices declined to intervene.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Her family thought they would return home the next day. Now, their house is gone
item.description: Jinghuan Liu Tervalon packed a few documents, keepsakes and clothing before leaving her Altadena, Calif., home ahead of the fast-moving Eaton Canyon Fire. Her son returned to find rubble and ash.
item.content:encoded:
Jinghuan Liu Tervalon packed a few documents, keepsakes and clothing before leaving her Altadena, Calif., home ahead of the fast-moving Eaton Canyon Fire. Her son returned to find rubble and ash.

(Image credit: Jervey Tervalon)
item.dc:creator: Frank Langfitt
